reasoning: Testicular hypogonadism (primary hypogonadism) is a chronic endocrine disorder; prevalence is the appropriate metric. Estimated prevalence ~24% of adult males (24,000 per 100k) based on clinical epidemiology and hormone screening studies, though definitions vary. Reported prevalence ranges 3-30% depending on diagnostic thresholds used.
source: Araujo AB et al. (2007). Prevalence and incidence of androgen deficiency in middle-aged and older men. Journal of Clinical Endocrinology and Metabolism. 92:4241-4247
